results.title: The DNA story
results.creator_credit: VSM Productions, Ronald Fouracre and Peter Shaw
results.brief_description: James Watson and Francis Crick at Cambridge, Maurice Wilkins at King’s College, London and Linus Pauling at Caltech describe the events and research leading to the discovery in 1953 of the double helix as a workable structure for DNA. Concentrates upon the role of chemistry and physics in finding the structure of DNA (deoxyribonucleic acid). Gives some background to the rise of molecular biology and the foundation of crystallography and model building.

results.title: The Divorce of lady X
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Alexander Korda and Tim Wheelan
results.brief_description: This is a delightful and light romantic comedy starring Laurence Olivier and Merle Oberon. A thick fog in London forces those at a fancy dress ball to remain overnight at the hotel where the ball is being held. As there is a room shortage the charming and lovely Leslie Steel (Oberon) is forced to share a room with the irritable and handsome lawyer Evarard Logan (Olivier). The lawyer assumes that the mysterious and yet unnamed character is married. The following day an accusing Lord Mee (Ralph Richardson) talks of his wife spending the night in a man’s room. Smitten and bewildered Everard Logan is forced to think of the consequences believing that he might know the clients of a divorce case that he is working on better than he thought! This easy going yet sophisticated comedy is well performed and enjoyable.

results.title: The division of radiophysics
results.brief_description: Describes the current research work being undertaken by the CSIRO division of Radiophysics, including radio astronomy, moon echoes, radar meteorology, radio-controlled models, rain making, electronic computing, radar aids to navigation, aids to airport control, and upper air investigations.

results.title: The Divine Garbo
results.creator_credit: Turner Pictures, Ellen Krass and Susan F Walker
results.brief_description: Garbo - the undefinable mystique. The most elusive, seductive and enigmatic actress the cinema has ever known, this Swedish star attracted audiences like no other. Her intense desire for privacy became legendary, vanishing from the screen - and the public - at the height of her commercial success. Hosted by actress Glenn Close, this video presents an insight to the mysterious Greta Garbo, including clips from such films as “Grand Hotel”, “Queen Christina”, “Anna Karenina”, “Camille” and “Ninotchka”, plus some rare behind-the-scenes glimpses, screen-test footage and foreign film clips - all of which only add to enhance the legend of one of Hollywood’s most elusive screen love goddesses.

results.title: The Divided man: commitment or compromise
results.creator_credit: Stephen Bosustow Productions, Film Polski, Miniature Film Studio and Milosaw Kijawicz
results.brief_description: An animated film which proves the maxim that one cannot travel two roads at the same time without being diminished. Vascillating from side to side, a man struggles to make a decision. In an effort to make the “perfect” choice he divides himself and travels two paths. However when his two halves attempt to reunite one half has shrunk.

results.title: The Distant lens
results.creator_credit: Perth Institute of Film and Television, Paul D. Barron, Owen Paterson and Glenda Hambly
results.brief_description: Looks at the past of Western Australia, taking the audience through a kaleidoscope of events, including two wars, Royal visits, the Group Settlement, the first aeroplane flights, and the 1920 centenary parades. Composed of photographs and archive film.

results.title: The Dispersal of seeds and fruits
results.brief_description: Considers the origin of seeds and fruits and discusses the need to spread these structures in order to avoid excessive competition, and to spread the species. Illustrates the agencies for dispersal - wind, animal and less common, water.

results.title: The Disney channel. -Volume 5.
results.brief_description: Features 2 hours of entertainment from the Disney channel. Included in this volume: GOOD MORNING MICKEY: “Symphony hour; WELCOME TO POOH CORNER: “Eeyore’s costume party”; directed by Philip F. Messina, based on the books by A. A. Milne and illustrated by Ernest H. Shepard. Narrated by Laurie Mann: MOUSE FACTORY: “Home owners”; produced and directed by Ward Kimball and featuring Jim Backus as Mickey’s friend: DONALD DUCK PRESENTS: “Magic and music” plus “Peter and the wolf”; directed by Clyde Geronimi and told by Stirling Holloway: MOUSERCISE; produced by George Taweel, directed by Gordon Myers and featuring Kellyn, Donald, Goofy and friends. There are tracking problems at the beginning of this segment.

results.title: The Disney channel. - Volume 2
results.brief_description: Memorable moments from the Disney channel are included on this tape including: GOOD MORNING MICKEY “Lion’s down”; Goofy features in this cartoon directed by Jack Kinney; WELCOME TO POOH CORNER “Spaghetti”; Tigger and Winnie the Pooh tackle some spaghetti, produced by Caroline Hay and directed by Donald R. Ham; THE MOUSE FACTORY “The Reluctant dragon”; Not all dragons breathe fire and wreak fear amongst men as this story shows, produced and directed by Ward Kimball; DONALD DUCK PRESENTS “A Day at Disneyland”; You’ll feel like you’ve been there after this expedition, produced by Matt Oppenheimer and directed by Barry Elliott; MOUSERCISE; Join Kellyn, Mickey and friends for some healthy exercise. Produced by George Taweel and directed by Gordon Myers.

results.title: The Dismissal
results.creator_credit: Kennedy-Miller, Terry Hayes, George Miller, Phil Noyce, George Ogilvie, Carl Schultz and John Power
results.brief_description: A fictional account of the events that led up to the decision, made by Sir John Kerr, to sack Gough Whitlam as Prime Minister and appoint Malcolm Fraser in his place.

constellations_other.name: George Miller
constellations_other.description: For a guy who started his career as a physician, George Miller sure is a diverse filmmaker.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Kennedy-Miller, Terry Hayes, George Miller, Phil Noyce, George Ogilvie, Carl Schultz and John Power
results.description: A fictional account of the events that led up to the decision, made by Sir John Kerr, to sack Gough Whitlam as Prime Minister and appoint Malcolm Fraser in his place. The events covered occurred over the period between 1972 and 1975 and have been arranged, in the film, into six parts. Cast: Peter Carroll, Bill Hunter, John Hargreaves, John Meillon, Max Phipps, John Stanton, Arthur Dignam, Ruth Cracknell, Nancy Hayes.
